DOCNAME: CASE OF DİSK AND KESK v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association (Article 11-1 - Freedom of peaceful assembly);Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants jointly notified the FAC district governor that they would be gathering before the GPE PERSON memorial on DATE at TIME to celebrate Labour Day and commemorate their friends who had lost their lives during the demonstrations of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the FAC district governor authorised a gathering at the requested location for representatives of trade unions only . The district governor specifically indicated that a demonstration on a larger scale at the said location was not authorised .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , certain government authorities , including the Minister of the ORG and the ORG ’s spokesman , as well as the GPE Governor ’s office , issued press statements , declaring that they were in possession of intelligence reports which precluded them from authorising any demonstration in FAC , for security reasons . The authorities held that any demonstration held in GPE on CARDINAL DATE would be unlawful and unconstitutional on account of possible provocations and disruption of traffic and public order . They further stated that they were going to take extensive security measures on DATE , including shutting down certain schools in the nearby districts , stopping the operation of ferries and subways , blocking the roads leading to FAC and deploying extra police for DATE . As alternative locations , the GPE Governor ’s office indicated CARDINAL other squares for the demonstration , namely CARDINAL on the NORP side and QUANTITY on the NORP side of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant lodged a complaint against the Governor of GPE with the GPE public prosecutor , accusing him of denying the trade unions their right to assembly in a discriminatory manner . The first applicant complained that there was no justification for denying them access to FAC on Labour Day , when the same location was available for other large - scale demonstrations and celebrations ( investigation no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . At TIME , members of the PERSON and KESK began gathering in front of the ORG headquarters located in the district of PERSON for Labour Day celebrations . At TIME the police asked the group to disperse , warning them that they were acting in violation of ORG ( Law no . CARDINAL ) . The members of the group refused , arguing that they were merely waiting in front of the ORG headquarters , which was a pedestrian area , and that they were not violating the said law in any way . The police , however , proceeded to disperse the group , by spraying them with pressurised water , paint and tear gas , both inside and outside the ORG building .

CARDINAL . Similar police interventions occurred over DATE with increasing intensity . Some of the demonstrators were injured as a result of the use of force by the police . While the injured demonstrators were trying to reach the nearby ORG for medical care , they were chased by the police and were subjected to gas attacks even within the hospital LOC . Some members of the PERSON were arrested .
CARDINAL . At TIME the group of demonstrators broke up of its own accord to forestall any further violence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief of ORG gave a statement to the police , stating that on DATE around CARDINAL demonstrators had entered the hospital and opened a banner . Subsequently , police officers had also entered the hospital premises in their pursuit and used a gas bomb in the hospital ’s garden to neutralise the demonstrators . He further explained that CARDINAL of the police officers had mistakenly sat on a gas bomb and exploded it in the police car parked at the entrance of ORG ; as a result staff working in ORG as well as some of the patients had been affected . He concluded by stating that the gas bomb was not deliberately thrown in the hospital building .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date after DATE , the director of the ORG , along with other persons , lodged a complaint with the GPE public prosecutor against various authorities , including the office of the Prime Minister , the Minister of the ORG , the Minister of ORG , the GPE Governor ’s office , the Head of ORG and the police officers involved in the incidents of DATE , accusing them of breach of the right to freedom of assembly and a disproportionate use of force ( investigation no . CARDINAL ) . On an unspecified date , the public prosecutor issued a decision of lack of jurisdiction in connection with the complaint lodged against the GPE Governor and the Head of ORG . The case file was accordingly transferred to ORG at ORG . Pursuant to the terms of PERSON no . DATE , the public prosecutor at ORG sought authorisation from the Minister of the ORG to prosecute the GPE Governor and the Head of ORG . On an unspecified date , the Minister refused to do so . Consequently , on DATE the public prosecutor decided not to proceed with the case . This decision was notified to the applicants’ lawyer on DATE . The applicant ’s appeal lodged against this decision was further dismissed by ORG as the court held that pursuant to domestic legislation , no appeal was possible against the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . Regarding the complaint lodged against the Prime Minister , the Minister of the ORG , and the Minister of ORG , on DATE the GPE public prosecutor delivered a decision of non - prosecution , holding that pursuant to the LAW , the Prime Minister , the Minister of the ORG , and the Minister of ORG could not be held liable for their actions in the course of their duties . This decision was served on the applicants’ lawyer on DATE . The ORG appeal was rejected on CARDINAL DATE by ORG , which held that no objection could be lodged against the decision of the public prosecutor dated DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the representative of the first applicant handed to the PERSON public prosecutor an undetonated gas bomb belonging to the police force , found inside the ORG headquarters following the events of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a complaint lodged by the GPE Governor ’s office , the ORG public prosecutor questioned the director of the ORG in relation to the events that took place on DATE ( investigation no . CARDINAL ) . It appears from the documents in the case file that no prosecution was initiated against the applicants in relation to the events of DATE .
“ Everyone has the right to hold unarmed and peaceful meetings and demonstration marches without prior permission .
The formalities , conditions , and procedures governing the exercise of the right to hold meetings and demonstration marches shall be prescribed by law . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law No . CARDINAL prohibits demonstrations and processions on public streets , in parks , places of worship and buildings in which public services are based . Demonstrations organised in public squares have to comply with security instructions and not disrupt ORG movements or public transport . Finally , LAW provides that demonstrations and processions which do not comply with the provisions of this law will be dispersed by force on the order of the governor ’s office and after the demonstrators are warned .
